metadata.title: CVE-2022-46874 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A file with a long filename could have had its filename truncated to removethe valid extension, leaving a malicious extension in its place. This couldpotentially led to user confusion and the execution of maliciouscode.
*Note*: This issue was originally included in the advisories forThunderbird 102.6, but a patch (specific to Thunderbird) was omitted,resulting in it actually being fixed in Thunderbird 102.6.1. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 108, Thunderbird < 102.6.1, Thunderbird <102.6, and Firefox ESR < 102.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46874` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '108.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
